Chapter 6 Interactive component 6.1 Link to the interactive graph Click here or the link below: https://rawcdn.githack.com/gbZachYin/StuPerfAnalysis/3ad151d391449183e57fb2b7bfa18392a36c2dd6/ic.html 6.2 Descriptions The interactive component of the project is mainly built with d3.js version 6 and Danfo.js version 3.3. The former is for plot and the latter is for dataframe processing in JavaScript. The raw HTML code is uploaded to the project Github repo named ic.html. The collapsible tree and dynamic barchart below it display how the distribution of students final letter grade varies as the tree structure changes. 6.3 Instructions for using the plot There are three deterministic variables (i.e.Â Mothers education level, number of past class failures, and extra educational support) that have the strongest association with final grades regardless of the subject. The plot is initialized with all nodes being collapsed except for Medu in the tree and the distribution of all students final grades for Math in the bar chart. Users can click the button at the top to choose the subject (Math or Portuguese). Users can either expand or collapse a certain node. The tree can be viewed as a filter. For instance, a tree with nodes failures-0 and SchoolSup-Yes expanded meaning that the final grade distribution for students who have no courses failed in the past and receive educational support are shown. References: Mike Bostock: Collapsible Tree (https://bl.ocks.org/mbostock/4339083) Danfo: powerful javascript data analysis toolkit (https://github.com/javascriptdata/danfojs) Observable: d3-6.0 Migration Guide (https://observablehq.com/@d3/d3v6-migration-guide#events)
